headline: Do you wake up in a sweat overcome with regret?
subHeadline: A new survey shows 4 out of 10 people regret how they've lived their lives.

utterances.speaker: JOE SCARBOROUGH, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: Moscow Mitch said, it's a hoax. Moscow Mitch says it's a hoax.

utterances.speaker: DONNY DEUTSCH, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: Joe, I love that you're calling him Moscow Mitch because frankly, it's a continuation of something that you showed --

utterances.speaker: SCARBOROUGH
utterances.sentences: What am I supposed to call him, Cocaine Mitch?

utterances.speaker: DEUTSCH
utterances.sentences: It's a --

utterances.speaker: SCARBOROUGH
utterances.sentences: You know, people call him Cocaine Mitch. Maybe -- I don't know. Maybe he's right. I mean, he's only Cocaine Mitch, if he is running cocaine to Moscow, because he is Moscow Mitch.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: And he is Morning Bozo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, they called it a hearing, but it was more like, hard of hearing.

utterances.speaker: ROBERT MUELLER, FORMER SPECIAL COUNSEL
utterances.sentences: Can you repeat the question, sir? Could you repeat that, please? Can you repeat that for me?  Could you repeat that, ma'am?   Can you repeat the last part of that question? I apologize.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: MUELLER
utterances.sentences: Can you start it again? I'm sorry. Could you again repeat the question?  I'm sorry, what was the -- what was the question?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now, it could be that he was trying to run out the clock because for every repeat question he asked, you lose the time available for a new question. I tried this when Fox News questions the purchases on my corporate credit card.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I purchased a lot of leather goods for charitable purposes. But man, did that hearing tank? How bad was it? Worse than this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Worse than this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And worse than this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, at least the media took it well.

utterances.speaker: JEREMY BASH, MSNBC NATIONAL SECURITY ANALYST
utterances.sentences: I thought he was boring. He kind of sucked the life out of the report.

utterances.speaker: JEFFREY TOOBIN, CNN LEGAL ANALYST
utterances.sentences: Let's not kid ourselves. This has been a wall to wall failure.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: This whole hearing that we watched today was pretty close to a disaster.

utterances.speaker: RYAN LIZZA, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR, CHIEF POLITICAL CORRESPONDENT, ESQUIRE MAGAZINE
utterances.sentences: I think history will judge Mueller somewhat harshly here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: If any one of those people knew that this is what would happen today. Shame on them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, shame on you, you [bleep] for building this up like it was the Second Coming. Remember the hype leading up to this crap? The Dems and the media thought they were getting a puppy for their birthday, instead they got rabies.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They wanted the "Godfather" and got "Godfather III."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They wanted "Jerry Maguire" and instead, Jerry Springer. You could feel the soul-crushing disappointing. It's like when your date shows up and she doesn't look at all like her picture in her online profile. You know, you expect this, and instead you get this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I tricked a few. I could have been more honest. So, it's not Mueller's fault. No, it's the media who encouraged the Dems to pursue this circus. I call it stupid on stupid crime. No wonder nothing was in his purview.

utterances.speaker: MUELLER
utterances.sentences: This is outside my purview. It's outside my purview.   It's outside my purview. Outside my purview. It's not within my purview.   That's beyond my purview.  It's not within my purview. This is still outside my purview.  As I said before, I'm saying again, it's not my purview.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, purview. Now, there is an idea for a show, starring cats with strong political opinions.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's so bad. I don't need your pity applause. I do need it. All right. But it was never about collusion. That was just a charade used to nail Trump.  Remember, the media frothing now over Russia are the same jerks who mocked those who fought communism when the USSR was eight times larger, but I get it, the Dems have a problem in that America has no problems, except the ones that Democrats create. So, do the Democrats have nothing?

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: The Democrats had nothing. And now they have less than nothing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And you still ask the question, you know why?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: And you still ask the question. You know why? Because you are fake news. And you're one of the most -- and let me just tell you, the fact that you even asked that question, you're fake news, because you know what? He totally corrected himself in the afternoon, and you know that just as well as anybody.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: In case you missed it again, you're fake news.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Again, you're fake news and you're right at the top of the list also. That's why people don't deal with you because you're not an honest reporter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why would he say that? No, no, a very dumb and very unfair question.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No, no, a very dumb and very unfair question. So, you shouldn't even ask that question because you know it's a --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I wonder if you were untruthful when you asked that question.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: You're untruthful when you asked -- you are untruthful when you ask that question. And if you were ever truthful, you'd be able give the right question.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, who's done a great job?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: The administration, our President, me, we've done a great job.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Me." "Me. The President, me." They're having fun. I mean, the Trump campaign is now selling plastic straws. The first batch sold out. It's a great idea. Take something the left demonizes and poke them in the eyes with.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It made 200 grand, but it also exposes the left's absurd priorities. Think about what liberal policies have led to. They've ruined cities, screwed up law enforcement, handicapped borders, eliminated jobs, created education and housing bubbles. But a turtle might get a straw on the eye. Believe me, I love turtles, the soup is not bad. But more turtles get run over by liberals on their way to their homes in the Hamptons than by straws.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Meanwhile, Trump shows how the new Republican Party can harness the power of mockery, along the turfs solely owned by the smirking left. Now, the Libs are cranky old farts shaking their rake at those teens on skateboards and the right are the ones laughing their asses off, sipping whiskey from plastic straws.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But, you know the Trump campaign shouldn't stop with the straws. I see a whole product rollout based on scary stuff.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Missed out on the awesome Trump straws? Well, you're in luck because the all new line of 2020 Trump campaign merch is here, including lawn darts. The toy your parents never wanted you to have, but you're an adult now, so who cares what they think. Rotten eggs. Proven to fly 50 percent further than fresh eggs when throwing them at the low-energy nerds in chess club. Flaming bags of dog crap, because who needs regular dog crap when it's so much more awesome on fire? Bricks. Throw them through the windows of an abandoned house or use them to build a wall. An old board with a nail in it. This isn't your grandfather's old board with a nail in it. This one comes with a free tetanus shot.  A toaster fork. Need to pick up that stuck slice of bread? This 100 percent metal fork is the last one you'll ever need. The lame shrill media will tell you not to use it, but what do they know anyway? And finally a live Cobra in a tiny MAGA hat. Talk about the perfect stocking stuffer. It's the ultimate line of Trump 2020 campaign merchandise. Note to the coolest, none of these exists, so please don't stick forks in a toaster. That's dangerous.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guests. He is so patriotic the American flag salutes him. "Fox & Friends" weekend cohost, Pete Hegseth.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's got friends in really high places, theologian ethicists and Fox News contributor, Jonathan Morris.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She is outspoken when she's not talking. Host of "Sincerely, Kat" on Fox Nation, Katherine Timpf. I wrote that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He is larger than life and basically most other things, my massive sidekick and host of "Nuff Said" on Fox Nation, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Pete, I was watching the responses. I don't think it's fair to blame Mueller. He did -- I don't think he wanted to be there. They should blame themselves for pushing this charade.

utterances.speaker: PETE HEGSETH, HOST
utterances.sentences: Of course, he didn't want to be there. He wrote a report. He didn't write it. He had everyone else write it. He put his name on top of it. Didn't even read it himself.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: And then when he didn't want to talk about it, he gave a press conference where he took no questions. It was totally scripted so that it could be the end of it. But then he became a private citizen. And as a result, they could subpoena him and he was forced to testify.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Then at the last minute, we found out his lawyer was going to come with him. And we thought, "Why is that happening?" Well, of course we know why now. He doesn't know the report.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Terrible.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: So, I mean, I kind of felt bad for the guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, did I.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: I really did. I mean, listen, this is a guy -- bronze star with valor in Vietnam.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Like legitimate American hero. Done a lot of great service to this country. Maybe hired the wrong people to do the investigation. Maybe the wrong motives. I don't know. But it was a sham and a charade and the Democrats should own it all the way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I agree. And you know what it reminds me of, Jonathan. And I mean, because you used to be a priest, it would be like me calling you up, after you've left the priesthood and said, "Can you come and do a confession over the weekend?"

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, FOX NATION HOST
utterances.sentences: I wasn't supposed to do that in the green room then.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, no. He doesn't do confessions anymore, Kat.  JONATHAN MORRIS, THEOLOGIAN/ETHICIST: I hear them, I just can't do anything about them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MORRIS
utterances.sentences: All right, faire enough. Sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What did you make of this week?

utterances.speaker: MORRIS
utterances.sentences: I felt -- I felt so bad, not just for Mueller, but for the American people that hundreds of people would be in this room talking about something that was not really that important for the end game of a nation that's stronger, a nation that's safer, a nation that helps people become the people that they can be on their own. Instead, it was the political class trying to gain points from the other side.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MORRIS
utterances.sentences: Which is just very sad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, you're right. You're right. I just love it, Kat that the media, they're eating more crow than my cousin Steve. And he --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: He sounds fun.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, he owns a crow farm. Where he raises -- he raises the birds for nourishment. He eats a lot of crow.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Is he single?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, he is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He is. You will never have to starve again.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Excellent. Sounds like my dream. I quit tomorrow. Yes, look, nobody found out anything new right from this hearing? Like, except maybe Robert Mueller?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: But other than that --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: It was just the same stories over and over again. If I wanted to hear the same stories over and over again, I would go to the bar, find the drunkest person there, they're probably named Chad, and talk to him for a little while, but at least Chad would probably have the decency to buy me a shot at some point, so I can have something that helped me get through it. The congressional Democrats didn't do that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, they didn't.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: They didn't buy me any shot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, they didn't.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: In fact, none of them ever have.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, in fact, you paid $30 million for that travesty.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's one hell of a shot.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right, Tyrus? GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, CONTRIBUTOR: Yes. Hell of a shot, Greg. Nice job.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Farming crows. All right. Let's talk about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I don't know. Maybe. I don't think I'm alone. I'm just going to keep it real. I didn't watch it.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I had a great day. I got up. Went and lift some weights.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Then I went to this new breakfast spot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I was supposed to get an egg white omelet, but nobody was watching. So I just got a regular one. Where am I at now, like around 11:30-ish?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Then I went -- got stuff to feed my shark.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait, you own a shark?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes, a shark. I have a horn shark in a fish tank. And then I fed him some shrimp and his little eel buddies. Then I went outside, watched my daughter play with her friends. Had a beer. Had another beer. Started giving my daughter life advice.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: At five? Where we at now? About 2:15?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Took a nap in a chair. Woke up with makeup on my face because I fell asleep and my five year old is a monster. 4:15, got in trouble with the missus for drinking beer around the kids again, that's what I did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And you were wearing her makeup.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Six o'clock, I ate again. I was supposed to eat something healthy. But I had burgers and hot dogs on the grill. Another beer. Took a nap again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Binge watched some stuff on Netflix that I didn't want to watch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Did you learn anything, Tyrus?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Flipped the channel said, "Oh, [bleep] Mueller was on today."

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: And guess what?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I knew the same thing before than I did afterwards because when it first came out, I watched it and I read it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Nothing changed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: So, yes, I had a great day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's the difference between you and a Democrat. The Democrats keep watching the same thing hoping the ending changes. They keep thinking that the Titanic is not going to hit the iceberg. It keeps hitting the iceberg. All right. Enough of me shouting, pushups and punches, we discussed the desperate Democrats, next.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: And now, “The Greg Gutfeld Show” presents "The 2020 CAN'T- idates."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's sad. Competition is now their ammunition. In the wake of Joe Biden's call for a pushup contest with Trump, Beto O'Rourke was spotted in an airport challenging his staffers to a pushup contest, prompting many to ask who is Beto O'Rourke?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why is he still here? Meanwhile, Cory Booker visited something called "Late Night with Seth Meyers." I'm told it's a TV show. Where he said he felt like punching President Trump.

utterances.speaker: SEN. CORY BOOKER, D-N.J., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: He puts his arm around me and he goes, "Dude, I want you to punch Donald Trump in the face?" And I stopped in my tracks and I go "Dude, that's a felony, man." Donald Trump is a guy who you understand he hurts you and you and my testosterone sometimes makes me want to feel like punching him, which would be bad for this elderly out of shape man that he is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Guys, guys, guys. All this tough talk is making me hot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All of this overflowing testosterone. You could smell it coming off them. Why not just settle it in the ring?

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Sunday, Sunday, Sunday. Get ready to be utterly unimpressed. It's the battle of the Betas Democrat Edition. Featuring the Newark nobody, the tough-talking testosterone time bomb, Cory Booker. As he tries to out-Beto the cruisin' for a losing Beto -- his actual name is Robert -- O'Rourke. With a combined weight of a bunch of pool noodles. This duo is guaranteed to leave you not wanting more. Unless you're a skater kid who love videos of middle aged men at the dentist. One speaks Spanish --

utterances.speaker: BETO O'ROURKE, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: (Speaking in Spanish).

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: The other speaks Spanish harder.

utterances.speaker: BOOKER
utterances.sentences: (Speaking in Spanish).

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Get there early and receive passes to our Safe Space Slam Poetry Symposium preshow with special guests, an army of nonthreatening guys named Toby. This show is softer than Obama's foreign policy. It's the battle of the Betas Democrat Edition.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, Jonathan, I have a theory that they're responding to the supportive media who are trying to tell them they have to act tough to fight Donald Trump. So, they're overcompensating in a way. What do you make of these guys?

utterances.speaker: MORRIS
utterances.sentences: I love the fact that the only thing they're talking about is Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MORRIS
utterances.sentences: They are not talking about any issues whatsoever. They're talking about -- they're doing pushups.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MORRIS
utterances.sentences: They're competing against their staff in pushups. And then they're talking about Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MORRIS
utterances.sentences: And that doesn't work.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MORRIS
utterances.sentences: Because Donald Trump has been President and he is doing things -- like him or not, he is doing things.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MORRIS
utterances.sentences: And that's what they have to compete against, and they're not. They're just talking about how he is -- well, that they can beat him up and punch him and other things like that. Ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. You know, Kat. I know. This is a big issue for you.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Pushups.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. You're kind of excited.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Kind of an itchy voter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: One itchy voter.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Beto O'Rourke watches “The Greg Gutfeld Show.”

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Because I said last week, that the only thing that matters to me in a candidate is pushups. And I'm influencing the race.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: It's so exciting. But the Cory Booker thing bothered me not so much because of what he said, but because of what wasn't included in the clips, which is before he said all these things, he says, "I don't want to stoop to President Trump's level by body shaming him," and then said --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Then he did it. That's what mean, mean, mean, middle school girls do. They're like, "I don't want to be mean, but Jessica's nose is huge. And I hate her." Like you, you were trying to be mean. So, I just -- if you're going to be mean, be like, "I'm going to be mean," which is something I appreciate about Trump. He's not like, "Not to mean." He just is mean.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes. He never conditions his insults --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Come out with it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Tyrus?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You've punched a lot of people. Do you think it's weird to hear politicians --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I believe the statute of limitations is right now, Greg. I am free and clear at the moment. Are we really sure that Booker can beat up the President?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Because I've been in a few scraps in my day, and I never talked like that before I got into a fight with somebody. "Hey, I hate to bring up my testosterone here guys." The only guys I knew that talked like that were guys who are afraid to fight. They give them reasons of all the things they have. "I know karate and I have a lot of testosterone. I have a lot of anger. But I'm going to refrain from swinging on you because you know, I don't want to be in court." That usually means, "I don't want to get beat up."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: And what if President Trump -- he'll beat him up before you even get to the fight because you'll be in his head.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I guarantee you if they square off, Mr. Booker will be crying before he throws the punch.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Because President Trump is going to talk about his mama.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: He is going to talk about him. He is going to talk everything about him. And if he -- "you just leave me alone." And he wins. He wins. He gets broken up. He is crying. The President is going to look at him, he's crying. He wins.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: So, yes -- well, don't do that.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Well, to go back to the tape. It's not clear that Beto O'Rourke could even be -- Robert Francis O'Rourke could even beat Trump. He couldn't beat his own staffer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: I mean, the staffer --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Well, he beat that one.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: He beat the one.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: To the right of him, but the guy in front of him was smoking him.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: So, he's got no shot. I mean, this is the last and lowest common denominator of politics. When you hate somebody, you go to a fist fight. You can't figure it out with words, you're going to find it out. And they don't have anything to say. He can't differentiate himself from other politicians. I mean, I will guarantee you one thing right now. Cory Booker will never be President of the United States.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: That I could predict.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But you know what?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie. President Trump is facing backlash for calling a Democratic lawmaker's district "rat infested." The President also called Congressman Elijah Cummings a bully for condemning the treatment of migrants at the U.S.-Mexico border. Cummings is the Chairman of the House Oversight Committee. Thousands including celebrities and lawmakers are now using the hashtag #WeAreBaltimore in a show of solidarity with the city. Overseas, at least eight people are dead after earthquakes rocked the northern Philippines. Dozens are injured. The quake has destroyed homes with some residents still pinned inside. At least three quake struck today. Two were back to back. Earthquakes happen frequently in the Philippines because it lies on the so-called Ring of Fire. I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back to “The Greg Gutfeld Show.” For all your headlines, log on to foxnews.com.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is it worth it to fight them if they've got more than 10 items? A police report is disputing the account of a Democratic Georgia lawmaker who is black, who claimed that a white man told her to go back where you came from during a tiff at a grocery store. Now, the argument didn't start over race or politics or even Trump. It started when the guy said she had too many items in the express lane. Here's her original account.

utterances.speaker: ERICA THOMAS, D-GA, STATE REPRESENTATIVE
utterances.sentences: For that white man to come up to me and called me a son of a [bleep] and lazy and go back where I came from because he had a couple of items that he wanted to get in front of me. And he said I had 20 items in a 10-item line. What will make you angry --

Surveillance footage showed what happened, but you can't hear anything. Nothing outrageous seemed to have occurred get this whole thing exploded because the woman injected race into the matter and then spread it all over social media. Still, police aren't filing any charges against anyone. But the lesson is clear. If you've got more items than the limit allows, then go back where you came from, and put it back on the shelf. And then come back.

So, I was feeling less scared until I saw this, a flame thrower attached to a personal drone. That is the TF-19 wasp. It's made by a company called Throw Flame, of course, it's not Nestle Quick. For 1,500 bucks, it gets shoot flames 25 feet with 90 seconds of pure brutal hellfire, check out their ad.

utterances.sentences: Pete, I didn't expect the direction of this segment.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: No, neither did it. Regrets are overrated.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Okay, Karen, you threw up in my purse.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: I have thrown up in purses before.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I knew it.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Not yours. Not yours.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Not yet.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: I've made plenty of mistakes, we all have. But if you dwell on them, what's the deal? Like we learn from every mistake we make. Big or small and you move on. But don't dwell on it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: That's it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's what I am saying, I'm also saying like each regret, I mean, whatever you did you regret actually moves you to a place where you are. And if you went the other direction, you could be dead, you know.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: You could be a Democrat.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: And she'd still be at the cemetery reminding my dead self what I did to get there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, the "Gutfeld Monologues Live" returns this fall. September 14th, I'll be in Orlando, Florida; September 15 in Atlanta, Jacksonville and Durham in November. Knoxville in December. Go to ggutfeld.com for ticket info.

utterances.sentences: We are out of time. Special thanks to Pete Hegseth, Jonathan Morris, Kat, Tyrus, studio audience. I'm Greg Gutfeld and I love you, America.
